1.str2: Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.

18.str2: Corruptible, perishable. From phtheiro; decayed, i.e. perishable.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of arguros; silvery, i.e. cash; specially, a silverling.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
A piece of gold, golden ornament. Diminutive of chrusos; a golden article, i.e. Gold plating, ornament, or coin.

18.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
18.str2: To release on receipt of ransom; mid: I redeem, release by paying ransom, liberate. From lutron; to ransom.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Vain, unreal, ineffectual, unproductive; practically: godless. From the base of maten; empty, i.e. profitless, or, an idol.
Dealing with other men, conduct, life, behavior, manner of life. From anastrepho; behavior.

18.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
18.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Handed down by (from) one's ancestors, inherited. From pater and a derivative of paradidomi; traditionary.

19.str2: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
Blood, literally, figuratively or specially; by implication, bloodshed, also kindred.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
A lamb (as a type of innocence, and with sacrificial connotation). Apparently a primary word; a lamb.
Blameless, without blemish, unblemished, faultless. Unblemished.

20.parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Singular
20.str2: To know beforehand, foreknow. From pro and ginosko; to know beforehand, i.e. Foresee.
From kataballo; a deposition, i.e. Founding; figuratively, conception.
Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).

20.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Genitive Masculine Singular
20.str2: To make clear (visible, manifest), make known. From phaneros; to render apparent.

Last, at the last, finally, till the end. A superlative probably from echo; farthest, final.

The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

21.str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.

And, even, also, namely.
Hope, expectation, trust, confidence. From a primary elpo; expectation or confidence.

A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

22.str2: Brotherly love, love of Christian brethren. From philadelphos; fraternal affection.

22.str2: To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.

Earnestly, strenuously, fervently. Adverb from ektenes; intently.

23.str2: To beget again, beget into a new life. From ana and gennao; to beget or bear.
